auditorium

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • auditorium.Log

  • public class Log
extends java.lang.Object
    Log's job is to serialize messages that are heard over auditorium. In addition, the log keeps data structures around that allow it to quickly compute whether or not a given s-expression has been heard before, as well as keep track of what the most recently heard but not pointed to messages are. (This is useful for helping the temporal layer decide what messages should be pointed to when said messages are being constructed.)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Log

        public Log(java.io.File location)
    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Construct a Log instance that serializes log data to a given location.
        Parameters:
        location - This is the location that should be written to.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - This method throws if the given location cannot be found.

    • Method Detail

      • logAnnouncement

        public boolean logAnnouncement(Message message)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Call this method to check and see if a message has been seen before, and if it has not, log it.
        Parameters:
        message - This is the message in question. Log it if it hasn't been seen before.
        Returns:
        This method returns true if something new gets added to the log, and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This method throws if there is an IO error when trying to add the message to the log file on disk.

      • updateLast

        public void updateLast(MessagePointer message)
        Add a message to the "last" list. This message will be included in the pointer set for the next message sent out.
        Parameters:
        message - Add this message.

      • removeFromLast

        public void removeFromLast(MessagePointer message)
        Remove a pointer from the last list, if it exists in the list.
        Parameters:
        message - Remove this message from the last list.

      • getLast

        public MessagePointer[] getLast()
        Get a list of messages that have been seen but not yet referenced. Calling this method effectively clears the last list (before saving it as a return value).
        Returns:
        This method returns the last list.

      • write

        private void write(Message message)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • TESTgetSetCopy

        public java.util.HashSet<MessagePointer> TESTgetSetCopy()
        THIS METHOD IS ONLY USED FOR TESTING. Use the return value of logAnnouncement to know whether or not you've seen a message (becaues the lookup is done atomically with the store!)

      • TESTgetLast

        public java.util.List<MessagePointer> TESTgetLast()
        THIS METHOD IS ONLY USED FOR TESTING. Use getLast() in practice, because it gets the last set and then subsequently clears it in one atomic operation.
